BF.name: BOOT_FAIL
BF.description: Job terminated due to launch failure, typically due to a hardware failure (e.g. unable to boot the node or block and the job can not be requeued).

F.name: FAILED
F.description: Job terminated with non-zero  exit  code  or  other failure condition.

CA.name: CANCELLED
CA.description: Job  was explicitly cancelled by the user or system administrator.  The job may or may  not  have  been initiated.

CG.name: COMPLETING
CG.description: Job is in the process of completing. Some processes on some nodes may still be active.

CF.name: CONFIGURING
CF.description: Job has been allocated resources, but  are  waiting for them to become ready for use (e.g. booting).

NF.name: NODE_FAIL
NF.description: Job  terminated due to failure of one or more allo‐ cated nodes.

CD.name: COMPLETED
CD.description: Job  has terminated all processes on all nodes with an exit code of zero.

TO.name: TIMEOUT
TO.description: Job terminated upon reaching its time limit.

S.name: SUSPENDED
S.description: Job has an allocation, but execution has been  suspended and CPUs have been released for other jobs.

ST.name: STOPPED
ST.description: Job has  an  allocation,  but  execution  has  been stopped   with  SIGSTOP  signal.   CPUS  have  been retained by this job.

SE.name: SPECIAL_EXIT
SE.description: The job was requeued in a special state. This state can be set by users, typically in  EpilogSlurmctld, if  the  job  has terminated with a particular exit value.
